description: Digital complement of n (replace each nonzero digit d by 10-d).
comments: a(n) = -n in carryless arithmetic mod 10 - that is, n + a(n) = 0 (cf. A169894). - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 03 2010.
links: N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
David Applegate, Marc LeBrun and N. J. A. Sloane, Carryless Arithmetic (I): The Mod 10 Version.
Index entries for sequences related to carryless arithmetic
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
maple: f:=proc(n) local t0,t1,i;t0:=0; t1:=convert(n,base,10);for i from 1 to nops(t1) doif t1[i]>0 then t0:=t0+(10-t1[i])*10^(i-1); fi;od:RETURN(t0);end;(from _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 21 2011)
mathematica: a[n_] := FromDigits[ IntegerDigits[n] /. d_?Positive -> 10-d]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 100}](* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Nov 28 2011 *)
prog: (Haskell)a055120 = foldl f 0 . reverse . unfoldr g where   f v d = if d == 0 then 10 * v else 10 * v + 10 - d   g x = if x == 0 then Nothing else Just $ swap $ divMod x 10-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 04 2011
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Apr 19 2000
